channel.title: My New Forum
channel.description:
First off, I have got permission from Mopar :)
Secondly, this isn't a Runescape forum whatsoever. So it is not like a normal free forum you would see. It is based on Counter Strike and Graphics. Which, I'm sure appeals to a few of you, especially those and the Gfx section.
The link for the site is http://countergfx.free-forums.org/countergfx.html - but please, only sign up if you will be sort of active :)

item.title: My New Forum
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

I signed up when I first saw this topic, but I forgot my password. I tried to receive my password, and I forget what email address I typed in. Could you check what email I used Mr.Chris? Then send it to me through PM here? Thanks if you can.

Read full topic

item.title: My New Forum
item.dc:creator: @Ben Ben
item.description:
@Ben wrote:

Not really, almost no successfull forum started like that, free forum hosting almost NEVER works unless you use it to communicate with people you know IRL.

Read full topic

item.title: My New Forum
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

I understand where your coming from, but everyone started out in the same position as I am. [br][size=1]Posted at: May 15, 2006, 08:49:24 am[/size][hr]Awww, still no one…I’m still detirmined

Read full topic

item.title: My New Forum
item.dc:creator: @Ben Ben
item.description:
@Ben wrote:

I’m sorry to disappoint you but it’s not going to work out.
There’s nothing to people to look for there, just like the reason I am here - I’ve started working on a Rs2 bot and still am not beyond the stage of generating mouse movements/clicks or keyboard events – I’m clueless.
In here I might be able to get my answer, which is why I am here.

When I first started 3rxNet we had nothing there, it was going for a month and it was more dead than it was when we started.
After a while, I was bored and made a new scriptable bot, that attracted some new members – Most of them just downloaded the bot and left.

Then, there was an MC update (yeah I’m talking about RSC) and I made it so you have to be active on the forums (average of 5 posts a week, visiting atleast 10 times a month), people were joining and posting in masses.

The community grew and everything and then RSC died, about 80% of the members left after that, and slowly left.
Now I’m here with about 100 loyal members(out of 1000 registered users) who have stayed.

What I’m trying to say is that your forums has to have something that attracts people, something you won’t get at most places.

At some cases it only takes to have a respected administrator, for example the kaitnieks community. Just finding a forum to post in is a peice of cake nowdays, you need to make people feel like they need to be a part of the community, or just make them post to gain something.

I hope this enlighten your eyes from the illusion you’ve got.

  • Ben

Read full topic

item.title: My New Forum
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

CG as in Computer Generated. And not renders like game renders used in sigs. Renders as in what comes from Computer Generated. Basically, things like models when they’re rendered. Photorealistic Renders, etc.

Read full topic

item.title: My New Forum
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

CG, if you could enlighten me. I’ll also just create a renders section. I forgot that one The Graphics section is pretty big, and I’m open to suggesstions.

Read full topic
